thread.title: Why Darlington's General Election win for Labour has become even more crucial

author: Mike Kelly
title: Why Darlington's General Election win for Labour has become even more crucial
text:
News Why Darlington's General Election win for Labour has become even more crucial The North East marginal was a top Tory target and as they didn't win it, alarm bells will start ringing for Prime Minister Theresa May Share Click to play Tap to play The video will start in 8 Cancel Play now   Thank you for subscribing!   
Labour has held Darlington, a result which took on huge significance at the 2017 General Election . 
It was a top Tory target with the party putting huge resources into the constituency and its candidate Peter Cuthbertson. 
Yet Jenny Chapman held it by 3,280 votes, a slight increase on the 2015 result. 
Its significance is it gives greater credence to the findings of the exit poll. Shadow Brexit secretary Sir Keir Starmer and Jenny Chapman (Photo: PA) 
While it predicted a hung parliament, the actual results have presented a more confusing picture with some questioning its accuracy. 
The exit polls predicted a 15% increase in the Labour vote and a 2% one for Conservatives. 
By the time Newcastle North result came in at 12.20am as a win for Labour’s Catherine McKinnell, it stood at a 9% increase for Labour and 8% for the Conservatives. 
While Labour, as expected, won Newcastle Central, Houghton and Sunderland South, Newcastle East, Sunderland Central and Washington and Sunderland West, the margin of victory wasn’t as large as the exit poll predicted. Read More 
The Swindon North result, even though a defeat for Labour, saw them do better than the exit poll prediction with a 3.7% swing to the party from the Tories. 
But the Darlington result at 1am has made a very confusing picture a bit clearer. 
The Tories not winning the seat was a massive blow. Labour holding it provides a great boost for Jeremy Corbyn. Read More
